entry.title: DENSE FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. SATURDAY
entry.summary: November 8, 2025 5:50 a.m. A Dense Fog Advisory remains in effect for much of southwestern Oregon through 10:00 a.m. Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said visibility of one quarter mile or less is expected in dense fog. The Advisory area includes central Douglas County, eastern Curry County, Josephine and Jackson...

entry.title: PacifiCorp Credit Downgrade Raises Bankruptcy Concerns Amid Wildfire Lawsuits
entry.summary: PacifiCorp, the Oregon-based utility owned by Warren Buffett, warns of a potential liquidity crisis amid lawsuits over the 2020 wildfires. Facing billions in damages and credit downgrades, the company says ongoing litigation threatens its long-term operations.

entry.title: Canyonville ODOT Station Retains Funding, Continues Key Role in Highway Safety
entry.summary: The Canyonville ODOT station will remain fully staffed after avoiding budget cuts. The small crew plays a vital role in keeping I-5 and nearby highways safe, responding quickly to winter storms, emergencies, and incidents across southern Douglas County.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.7.25
entry.summary: Christopher Hudson of Lexeme Wines and Jack Costa of the Umpqua Valley Wine Growers Association talk about this year’s harvest, the upcoming Winesgiving Weekend and other related topics in this Wine in the Umpqua program.

entry.title: Upscale Resale to Close After 30 Months, Offers Half-Off Storewide Sale
entry.summary: Upscale Resale in Sutherlin is closing at the end of November after 30 months in business. The consignment shop is offering half off all items and waiving its share of sales as a thank-you to the community for its support.

entry.title: GOVERNOR ANNOUNCES THAT OREGONIANS NOW HAVE ACCESS TO SNAP BENEFITS
entry.summary: November 7, 2025 10:50 a.m. Thursday afternoon, a federal court ordered the Trump administration to immediately release 100 percent of funding to pay for Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program benefits for all recipients nationwide by Friday, including more than 750,000 Oregonians. A release from the Governor’s Office said following Governor Tina Kotek’s directive, the Oregon Department...

entry.title: Pretrial Motions Filed in Oakland Homicide Case
entry.summary: Attorneys for Dwayne Michael Lauka have filed multiple motions ahead of his February trial in the death of Terry Lea Deane, including a challenge to palm print evidence. Prosecutors maintain the evidence is valid and relevant to the case.

entry.title: Oregon Taxpayers to Receive 9.863% “Kicker” Credit After $1.41 Billion Surplus
entry.summary: Oregon residents will receive a 9.863% “kicker” credit on 2025 tax returns after a $1.41 billion surplus was confirmed. The credit will boost refunds or reduce taxes owed, with details available through the Oregon Department of Revenue.

entry.summary: Roseburg Public Library now offers access to thousands of digital newspapers through NewsBank.

entry.title: Oregon SNAP Benefits Fully Restored After Federal Court Ruling
entry.summary: Oregonians can now access their full November SNAP benefits after a federal court ordered the Trump Administration to release withheld funds. The Oregon Department of Human Services confirmed payments are restored, following Gov. Tina Kotek’s declaration of a hunger emergency.

entry.title: Canyonville ODOT receives funding, able to stay open in time for winter

entry.title: Oakland murder case heats up
entry.summary: Editors note: This article references a brutal murder, and contains language and information that may not be appropriate for some readers, especially children.

entry.title: Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopens after rehabilitation project
entry.summary: The Stewart Park Drive Bridge reopened Tuesday night after being closed to vehicle traffic for several months. The bridge, spanning the South Umpqua River, closed in February for a major rehabilitation project.

entry.summary: Paul Eckel said his time in the U.S. Army and Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) turned him into a tested combatant, but his time in the North Umpqua River has healed him immensely.

entry.title: DINT Arrests Myrtle Creek Man in Roseburg Drug Investigation
entry.summary: DINT detectives arrested 38-year-old Chet Evans of Myrtle Creek in Roseburg after finding suspected fentanyl, meth residue, and weapons. Evans faces drug and weapons charges and remains in custody on a Lane County probation detainer.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Arrested, Released on Bail in First-Degree Sexual Abuse Case
entry.summary: Jason Nathaniel Briggs, 43, of Roseburg, was arrested Oct. 28 on a charge of first-degree sexual abuse and later released on bail. Court records show three no-contact orders were issued. He’s due back in court Dec. 15 for a status hearing. The case remains under investigation.

entry.title: Southbound I-5 semi-truck fire near Winston extinguished
entry.summary: Fire crews extinguished a semi-truck fire on I-5 southbound near Winston Thursday morning. The blaze started in the engine compartment and spread to the cab and trailer loaded with paper rolls. No injuries were reported, and the cause is under investigation.

entry.title: Appeal Filed in Fatal UCC Softball Team Crash Case
entry.summary: A notice of appeal has been filed in the case of Jonathan Dowdy, sentenced to over 20 years for the fatal UCC softball team bus crash. Records show his sentence matched the plea agreement, and his earliest possible release date remains March 22, 2044.

entry.title: Oregon Connections 2025 Brings Together Broadband Leaders in Hood River
entry.summary: The 2025 Oregon Connections Telecommunications Conference brought more than 255 participants to Hood River for two days of learning, discussion, and connection. Broadband leaders, policymakers, and innovators from across Oregon gathered to share insights and advance the state’s work toward reliable, high-speed connectivity for all communities. entry.title: Grants Pass Awards $1.2 Million Homelessness Grant to Roseburg Developer
entry.summary: Grants Pass re-awarded a $1.2 million homelessness grant to Roseburg’s Elk Island Trading Group, which plans to build a container-home village for 150 people by summer 2026. The project could help the city close unmanaged camps and meet shelter space requirements.
